intro: Fleischmannia neei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleischmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun, making it a hardy plant in desert environments. Fleischmannia neei is often found in rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
